'show static variables' need to be set to generate the error

Fixed.
JDIModelPresentation was using the object receiver of field variables to find
variables with the same name.
But in the context of a static method, field variables object for the static
variables are created without object receiver. The call of #getReciever() on
those object was generating the ClassCastException.

Added information about the recieving type in IJavaFieldVariable.
Fixed JDIFieldVariable#getReciever().
Modified JDIModelPresentation#isDuplicateName() to use the recieving type
(always available) instead of the reciever.

Luc, I have changed the fix for this. I feel that the "revceiver", in the case 
of a static field, should be the class object (rather than null). So, I 
reverted the additoins of "getReceivingType()" (which is not necessary - the 
type of the receiver can be obtained from the receiver) and changed the 
implementation to return a class object in this case.

Correct (I was thinking of the Smalltalk model where class vars are actually 
inst vars in the class object (I think)). Reverted changes as originally done 
by you. Please verify I have all the required changes released.
*** Bug 44257 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
